intro: Neobartsia santolinifolia, commonly known as the Santolinifolia grass, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. It typically thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
